ngiemboon: Á tǎa ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ, e Ssé lʉŋte Ábalaham, ńtóŋo Ábalaham, á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Oon, wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!»
en: After these things God tested Abraham   and said to him, “Abraham! ”

ngiemboon: E Ssé gɔɔn ngie: «Lɔgɔ míŋ gù Ésàg, á míŋ gù wémɔʼɔ́ gẅie ɔ̀ kwoŋo yé tɛʼ, ńgʉa né ngwòŋ Moliya. Ɔ̀ ge kúu wó, é gʉa ndùm tsɔ́ lekwɔʼɔ́ sie n ge tó tá laʼte gú, é lɔgɔ yé é nuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ.»
en: “Take your son,” he said, “your only son Isaac, whom you love,   go to the land of Moriah,  # 22:2 2Ch 3:1 and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains I will tell you about.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham gÿo ḿmʉ́ mbaʼámbaʼ, éshʉ́a nkẅíŋ gẅie à ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ, ńdɔgɔ mmó ńzye nkàʼ nzikáasè ye, pɔ́ míŋ we Ésàg pâ ngàŋafàʼ yé yépʉ́a, é cʉ́me mánzsè légʉa né jʉʼ gie Ssé ka laʼte yé.
en: So Abraham got up early in the morning,   saddled his donkey, and took with him two of his young men and his son Isaac. He split wood for a burnt offering and set out to go to the place God had told him about.

ngiemboon: Ńgiŋ giŋ tà é gwɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ sétá, Ábalaham tyé tsɔ́ jʉʼ, ḿmaʼa lejÿɔ́g tàa ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a, ńgyá jʉʼó.
en: On the third day   Abraham looked up and saw the place in the distance.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né ngàŋafàʼ yé ngie: «Pi lâ nzikáasè zẅíʼte jʉʼɔɔn, peg míŋ wɔ̀ɔn gʉa ndùm lekwɛ́ sɛ̂, ńguʼte Ssé, tá ḿbiŋ nzèm ńtsɛ́ɛ gẅí.»
en: Then Abraham said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey. The boy and I will go over there to worship; then we’ll come back to you.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham gɔɔn púʼu, ńkaa nkẅíŋ gẅie à ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ, ńzába twó míŋ we Ésàg. Kwàʼ yé pí mmɔ̌g pɔ́ pùʼ ńgẅiin. Pɔ́ míŋ we pú ńgʉa mépʉ́a.
en: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and laid it on his son Isaac.   In his hand he took the fire and the knife,  # 22:6 Jdg 19:29; Pr 30:14 and the two of them walked on together.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la né ńgee púʼu, Ésàg zɛ́te tá we Ábalaham ngie: «Tá wɔ̀ɔn!» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Oon, n ne ńjúʼu mbà míŋ wɔ̀ɔn!» Ésàg zɛ́te ngie: «Pɔ̀gɔ gẅiin mmɔ̌g pɔ́ nkẅíŋ, nɔ̀ɔn gẅie ɔ̀ ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ, à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ nzɔ̌?»
en: Then Isaac spoke to his father Abraham and said, “My father.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn, e Ssé yé máŋwɛ́ ge náa nɔ̀ɔn gẅie n ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ!»
en: Abraham answered, “God himself will provide  ,# 22:8 Gn 22:14 the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.” Then the two of them walked on together.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu jʉʼ gie Ssé la laʼte mbwó Ábalaham, Ábalaham nyɛte jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ ńzáb nkẅíŋ ndumó. Ńdeen ńké ńkwɛ́ɛ kwàʼ míŋ we Ésàg, ńkaa yé ńzába ndùm nkẅíŋ.
en: When they arrived at the place that God had told him about, Abraham built the altar there and arranged the wood. He bound his son Isaac   and placed him on the altar  # 22:9 Heb 11:17; Jms 2:21 on top of the wood.

ngiemboon: É náa pwó ḿbíi pùʼ, lélɔg shʉ́ʉ lóŋ míŋ we Ésàg.
en: Then Abraham reached out and took the knife to slaughter his son.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, cÿɔ́ʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó lefaŋ ńtóŋo Ábalaham ngie: «Ábalaham, Ábalaham!» Ábalaham tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!»
en: But the angel of the Lord called to him from heaven and said, “Abraham, Abraham! ”

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie: «Te zába pwó na múɔ, te gÿo tsɔ́ nò tepòŋ na yé. N zsě fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ pɔ́g Ssé tà ɔ̀ kaa lʉʼʉ wɔ́ɔn míŋ gù, á míŋ gù wémɔʼɔ́ wɔ́.»
en: Then he said, “Do not lay a hand on the boy or do anything to him. For now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your only son from me.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham pʉʼʉ twó yé, ńgyá kùkwòon gie mendóŋ mé ně ńgÿo á léʼe tsɛ̀ɛ tsẅɛʼɛ́ legǐ menzóŋ. Ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńgwoon, ńdɔg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ ntuɔtuɔ, ńdɔg ńkúbe twó míŋ we ŋwɛ́.
en: Abraham looked up and saw a ram   caught in the thicket by its horns. So Abraham went and took the ram and offered it as a burnt offering in place of his son.

ngiemboon: Ábalaham tsẅi lezíŋ yɛ̌ jʉʼ ŋwɛ́ lê: «Andonaye-jʉre» (ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge ná). Áa mmó gie á gÿo, mé ée lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn ńgɔɔn ngie: Mé ge kúu lekwɛ́ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à ná.
en: And Abraham named that place The Lord Will Provide,   so today it is said, “It will be provided  # 22:14 Or “He will be seen on the Lord’s mountain.”

ngiemboon: Cÿɔ́ʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó lefaŋ, ńgíŋe ńtóŋo Ábalaham na mbɔ́ɔntè yépʉ́a,
en: Then the angel of the Lord called to Abraham a second time from heaven

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Ammó gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tsẅǐ tà ńkʉa, ayɔɔn: Páʼ ɔ̀ gÿǒ mmó gie mèŋ n tsẅǐi, tà ɔ̀ te lʉʼʉ míŋ gù, á míŋ gù wémɔʼɔ́, á mbwó mèŋ gẅie n gee Ssé wɔ́ la,
en: and said, “By myself I have sworn,”   this is the Lord’s declaration: “Because you have done this thing and have not withheld your only son,

ngiemboon: n ge cÿɔʼɔ gú, é gÿo ngẅɛ̀ jù shʉ́a, ńgyɔ́ɔn páʼ mecÿɔ́ʼsaŋ lefaŋ, mbɔɔ páʼ sàŋasáŋa gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe ntse máŋʉ́. Engẅɛ̀ jù ge láʼ jÿó metÿǒsoŋ megàŋmbù pɔ́b.
en: I will indeed bless you   and make your offspring as numerous as the stars of the sky  # 22:17 Gn 15:5; 26:4; Jr 33:22; Heb 11:12 and the sand on the seashore.  # 22:17 Gn 13:16; 32:12 Your offspring will possess the city gates of their  # 22:17 Lit his enemies.  # 22:17 Gn 24:60

ngiemboon: N ge láʼ fó na ngẅɛ̀ jù, é néŋ mbʉ́lè na mengwòŋ ntsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ. Ńtí nue ɔ̀ jǔʼ ncwò wɔ́ɔn.»
en: And all the nations of the earth will be blessed   by your offspring  # 22:18 Gn 12:3; 26:4; Ac 3:25; Gl 3:8 because you have obeyed my command.”

ngiemboon: Ábalaham piŋ nzèm, ńtsɛ́ ngàŋafàʼ yé, pâ pɔ̌ leen ńké ḿbú ḿbiŋ nzèm né Mbɛɛshÿeba, ńtí nue Ábalaham lɔ̌ɔn ńtsẅé wó.
en: Abraham went back to his young men, and they got up and went together to Beer-sheba. And Abraham settled in Beer-sheba.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn menò la tɔ́g, mé shwóŋo Ábalaham ngie: Mileka pɔ́ fɛ̌ gù Nahɔɔ la zyé yɔ́b púɔ mbàŋa.
en: Now after these things Abraham was told, “Milcah also has borne sons to your brother Nahor:

ngiemboon: Wɔɔn laa Ud múɔ letwó we, wɔɔn gwɔ́ fɛ̌ we Mbúuzè, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Kemuɛ tá pa Alam,
en: Uz his firstborn, his brother Buz, Kemuel the father of Aram,

ngiemboon: wɔɔn gwɔ́ Kesɛd, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Azɔɔ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Pindáshÿè, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Yindelab, ńgÿo Mbetuwɛ.
en: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”

ngiemboon: Mbetuwɛ la gÿo ńzyé yé Lɛpékà. Pɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa lefɔ̌ɔn pie Mileka pɔ́ Nahɔɔ fɛ̌ Ábalaham la zyé.
en: And Bethuel fathered Rebekah.   Milcah bore these eight to Nahor, Abraham’s brother.

ngiemboon: Nahɔɔ la gíŋe ńgẅiin tsɔ̌ manzwě, á gwɔ́ mágàb we; lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Leguma. À la gíŋe ńgẅiin yé penkʉ́: wɔ́ɔn laa Tébà, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Ngaham, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Taháshÿè ńgÿo Maaka.
en: His concubine, whose name was Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
